review text:
Originally our pediatrician recommended this lotion based on her dermatologist colleagues reviews. Because our little guy was going through some uncomfortable eczema flare ups on his face and arms we were willing to try any relief at that point.

The initial use was super effective- it added a nice moisturizing layer that seemed to soothe his skin almost immediately. We loved it until we started reading the ingredient list and noticed that it contained something called BHT.

Going down the google rabbit hold you'll see that this is found mostly in stuff like cereals, lipsticks etc because its a food preservative. Basically it prevents the chemical bond in fats and oils from transforming into different chemicals which may have foul smells when it comes it contact with oxygen. Bottom line - it's kind if scary. But I guess anything synthetic is really.

Anyhow the FDA deems this product as generally safe but the National Institute of Health says its reasonably anticipated to be a human carcinogen. Wow! I wasn't ready to start taking our chances no matter how low the dose of BHT was or how beautifully it worked on his skin.

Needless to say we made the decision to return and started treating it with coconut oil.

This wash is basically the same as the Vanicream gentle facial cleanser, which I love. I've used Vanicream's normal gentle wash but that made me itchy in uncomfortable areas so I stopped using it. One person gave this wash a one-star review stating that disodium EDTA is a formaldehyde-releasing agent which is completely false. Disodium EDTA is used in cosmetics to chelate (surround) a variety of metals which reduces their reactivity and in turn makes them less harmful when used by us consumers. Please educate yourselves and do your research before believing in something someone says online!

review name: This is the same Vanicream formula with Baby added to the name. Save the extra bucks!
review text: I asked on the Vanicream Facebook site what is the difference between this Baby formula versus the original. Vanicream responded that there is none. So basically you are paying a couple dollars more for the ‚ÄúBaby‚Äù labeling.

review name: I don't recommend Vanicream Baby Wash for sensitive skin, caused a bad rash!
review text:
When Aveeno and then Alaffia changed their body wash recipes, I started looking for a replacement. A few different people and a lot of online reviews recommended Vanicream Baby Wash so I decided to give it a try.

The ingredients in Vanicream are pretty straight forward: Purified Water; Glycerin; Coco Glucoside; Sodium Cocoyl Glycinate; Acrylates Copolymer; Caprylyl Glycol; Mica; Sodium Chloride; 1,2 Hexanediol; Titanium Dioxide; Sodium Hydroxide; and Disodium EDTA.

My first impression of Vanicream Baby Wash was a really good one. It was fragrance free like it promised, it lathered well, and made my skin feel smooth the first time I washed my hands with it. However, after using the product for three days my hand started to break out in a bad, bloody rash.

Upon development of the rash I stopped using Vanicream Baby Wash, but the rash would not go away. I tried every lotion, anti itch cream, and rash cream I've ever used in my life and nothing worked. Hydrocortisone even failed to clear it up. Eventually my doctor gave me a prescription steroid cream which cleared the rash up.

I cannot recommend this product for sensitive skin as I have extremely sensitive skin and developed a bad rash. I don't know which ingredient caused it, but Vanicream Baby Wash is definitely not the right body wash for me.

I‚Äôm a big believer in the Vanicream brand for myself and was very excited to see they have a baby line as well. My son has eczema and this product has been working great for him as well as the Vanicream Cream for Baby. Thank you Vanicream for making such a great products for adults and now children!

review name: Food allergy‚Äôs and eczema kid approved
review text: This is THE BEST and only lotion I can use on my son that has many food allergies and skin sensitive. It doesn‚Äôt sting on open eczema cuts and raw skin. It‚Äôs soothing and effective. We have been using for 5 year‚Äôs now. No issues and in the past we have uses many other brands(countless, 20 different ones recommended ones in all price ranges). We‚Äôve tossed all other away and only buy Vanicream. It last long. My son has reactive skin to lotions and sunblocks. He will break out in hives with some lotions due to the ingredients and plants used. He also has grass allergies so lots of plant or nut butter oiled based lotions trigger a reaction. Vanicream has been the best for us and we love the soaps and sunblock as well.

December 2019 my 2 year old was scratching so bad he was making himself bleed in his sleep. His elbows, knees, back & stomach was terrible with open sores & scars. We started using Vanicream baby soap & the sensitive lotion in November 2019 daily. By March 2020 his skin was CLEAR! I would recommend this to anyone! I have my whole family using the body wash. I even use it on my face it has my face so smooth & clear! It's so gentle! The lotion is so moisturizing! JUST GET IT!

This has significantly improved my 3 year old eczema. He had a bad flair for about 2 months and non of our go-to products were helping. The flair was on his face right near his eye so we did not want to use the prescription steroid creams. Fortunately we stumbled upon this brand and after the first application we noticed a difference. A few days later only a few small spots of eczema were left. We put it on him once or twice a day, usually right after bath time while his skin is still slightly damp. We used no other products on his face and this really cleared up the eczema. It worked so well I have switched his shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and hair gel to this brand.

The only thing I use on his face now is the balm called Egyptian Magic, and I only use it on areas where he has eczema breaking out and it helps make it disappear in 12-24 hours. review name: Same as regular Vanicream cream and facial cleanser
review text: The baby formula must be an Amazon marketing special because they are sold exclusively on Amazon. The ingredients are exactly the same as the regular/adult versions. The baby moisturizing cream is the same as Vanicream cream and baby wash is the same as Vanicream facial wash. I have used the facial wash to wash eyes lid area for years so it's definitely tear-free. I have also used it in a pinch to wash my hair and body in the gym so it's definitely good enough as shampoo and bodywash. However the adult version of the facial cleanser is cheaper for the same size bottle. You are just paying extra for the written assurance that it's for babies. That said, the products are good and I have both and use them daily, hence the five star rating.
I trust Vanicream with my own sensitive skin, so it was only natural that I would look to their baby line for my son. Works as advertised, very happy with this brand in general!

Edit: nth time to order. And this is the first time the lotion leaked out of the bottle with this new packaging.

My baby has eczema. We tried Mustela, Aveeno and other brands. This is the only brand that works for him. No dry flaky skin,no redness and itchyness ever since we started using this. This is our 3rd bottle for our 10month old.

One bottle lasts for 2 months.
